sub_title: PhD, Fulbright Hubert H. Humphrey Fellow| Sustainability Consultant| National Coordinator-Water, The Climate Reality Project India and South Asia | Was Assistant Professor, TERI School of Advanced Studies
summary: Dr. Fawzia Tarannum is a water sustainability professional, an educator, researcher, mentor, and social worker. She has 24 years of experience in project management, teaching, implementing sponsored projects, and capacity building. She is the recipient of Fulbright Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowship and has spent a year in Cornell University, to work on water and sanitation governance. She is also an awardee of the University of Nairobi- IDRC Doctoral Research Grant. In 2022, she was also recognised as one of the 17 SDG Women Changemaker by Sayfty and Twitter India. Prior to instituting WforW Foundation, she has worked as Assistant Professor at TERI School of Advanced Studies and as General Manager- Sales at Cleantec Infra Private Limited, a company engaged in providing mechanized solutions for cleaning and dredging of shallow water bodies. Fawzia has received the Climate Reality Leadership Corps Training by former Vice President, Al Gore, and has conducted capacity building programs on Water Conservation, Climate Change, Renewable Energy and Gender Equality, among others, for over 4000 students, teachers, government officials and youth groups in India. Her research interests are water-food-energy nexus, water policy, gender equity, participatory water governance and water conservation. Fawzia is also on the advisory board of GuruJal Society formed under the District Administration of Gurgaon, ALIG (A Literacy Initiative Group) and Taraqqi I Foundation.

treasury_media.description: The focus of the discussion wasn't confined to obvious binaries of gender. On the contrary, the webinar provided a platform where the impact of lockdown on all vulnerable communities including women, children, poor, transgender and others was discussed.

awards.description:
Sayfty Trust and Twitter India joined hands to recognize exemplary changemakers and how they’re
leveraging Twitter to advocate for the #GlobalGoals and make a difference. The partnership aimed to drive
greater participation of women in conversations relating to SDGs, with inclusion & safety as paramount.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of an emotional support group by the name "Prerna" for Cancer Patients.
volunteer_experiences.description: I would visit the hospital once a week and spend time talking with the patients and their relatives, playing games and organising talks with them. Since, Cancer requires a prolonged treatment, you tend to develop a bonding with your patients. They looked forward to my visit as much as I looked forward to meeting them. No monetary payment can replace the satisfaction that I would derive by bringing momentary smile on the face of my patients and their relative.The experience gave me both emotional and mental strength.
Trained by Vice President Nobel Laureate Al Gore in Climate Leadership to disseminate Climate Reality factors and truths.
